intro: Leucozoma kaputaricum, commonly known as the Kaputaricum fern, is a rare and unique plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that display a striking combination of green and white hues. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in dense rainforests. Its reproductive structures, including spore-bearing sporangia, are located on the underside of its leaves, a feature common among ferns. Due to habitat destruction, Leucozoma kaputaricum is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
